rounds.event: Bangladesh Liberation War: Over 200 of East Pakistan's intellectuals are executed by the Pakistan Army and their local allies. (The date is commemorated in Bangladesh as Martyred Intellectuals Day.)
births: Michaela Watkins, American actor and comedian
deaths: Mufazzal Haider Chaudhury, Bangladeshi linguist and scholar
Munier Choudhury, Bangladeshi author, playwright, and critic
Shahidullah Kaiser, Bangladeshi journalist and author

rounds.event: Plutonium (specifically Pu-238) is first isolated at Berkeley, California.
births: Lex Gold, Scottish footballer and civil servant
deaths: Anton Korošec, Slovenian priest and politician, 10th Prime Minister of Yugoslavia

rounds.event: Albania, Austria, Bulgaria, Cambodia, Ceylon, Finland, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Jordan, Laos, Libya, Nepal, Portugal, Romania and Spain join the United Nations through United Nations Security Council Resolution 109.
births: Jill Pipher, American mathematician and academic

rounds.event: Lisandro de la Torre and others found the Democratic Progressive Party (Partido Demócrata Progresista, PDP) at the Hotel Savoy, Buenos Aires, Argentina.
births: Karl Carstens, German lieutenant and politician, 5th President of the Federal Republic of Germany
Rosalyn Tureck, American pianist and harpsichord player

rounds.event: Convention against Discrimination in Education of UNESCO is adopted.
births: James Comey, American lawyer, 7th Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation
Chris Waddle, English footballer, manager, and sportscaster
